{"step_by_step_thinking": "Phenylbutyrate is a medication used to treat urea cycle disorders. The urea cycle is a process in which the body removes excess nitrogen. Phenylbutyrate works by providing an alternative pathway to remove excess nitrogen from the body. It does not activate enzymes of the urea cycle, nor does it directly excrete products of the urea cycle or maintain energy production.", "answer_choice": "D. Scavenges nitrogen"}
